title: Add vamp swarm CLI command
description:
## Description

CLI integration for swarm mode in the main vamp script.

## Commands

- `vamp swarm` - Start swarm with default 4 workers
- `vamp swarm --workers=N` - Start with N workers
- `vamp swarm --cleanup` - Run cleanup/merge workflow
- `vamp swarm --status` - Show status of active swarm

## Implementation Details

- Add swarm subcommand to bin/vamp
- Parse --workers, --cleanup, --status flags
- Validate worker count (2-8 reasonable range)
- Integrate with existing session management

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Subcommand parsing works
- [ ] Help text documented (`vamp swarm --help`)
- [ ] Error handling for invalid args
- [ ] Validates worker count range
- [ ] Integrates with vamp list/attach/kill

title: Create swarm tmux window layout
description:
## Description

New tmux window with configurable grid of panes for swarm workers.

## Implementation Details

- Default 4 panes (2x2 grid)
- Support --workers=N flag for custom count
- Each pane sized equally
- Window named "swarm"

## Layout Examples

```
2 workers:     4 workers:     6 workers:
+-----+-----+  +-----+-----+  +---+---+---+
|  1  |  2  |  |  1  |  2  |  | 1 | 2 | 3 |
+-----+-----+  +-----+-----+  +---+---+---+
               |  3  |  4  |  | 4 | 5 | 6 |
               +-----+-----+  +---+---+---+
```

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Creates window named "swarm"
- [ ] Splits into N equal panes
- [ ] Works with 2, 4, 6, 8 workers
- [ ] Panes are properly sized and balanced
- [ ] Window is separate from main vamp window

title: Implement cleanup/merge workflow
description:
## Description

`vamp swarm --cleanup` functionality for finishing swarm sessions.

## Features

- Show status of each worker branch (commits, diff stats)
- Option to merge completed branches back to main
- Remove worktrees after merge
- Handle conflicts gracefully

## Workflow

1. Show summary of each worker's changes
2. Prompt for merge strategy (interactive or auto)
3. Merge branches one by one
4. Clean up worktrees
5. Optionally delete swarm branches

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Shows diff stats for each branch
- [ ] Interactive merge or auto-merge option
- [ ] Cleans up worktrees after merge
- [ ] Handles merge conflicts with user guidance
- [ ] Option to keep or delete swarm branches

title: Implement git worktree management functions
description:
## Description

Functions for managing git worktrees for swarm workers.

## Functions

- `create_worktrees(count)` - Creates N worktrees in .vamp-workers/worker-{1..N}
- `cleanup_worktrees()` - Removes all swarm worktrees
- `list_worktrees()` - Shows status of swarm worktrees

## Implementation Details

- Create worktrees in `.vamp-workers/` directory
- Each worktree on branch like `swarm/worker-1`, `swarm/worker-2`
- Cleanup removes worktrees and optionally deletes branches
- Add `.vamp-workers/` to `.gitignore`

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] create_worktrees(count) creates isolated worktrees
- [ ] cleanup_worktrees() removes all swarm worktrees
- [ ] list_worktrees() shows status of each worktree
- [ ] Handles edge cases (existing worktrees, dirty state)
- [ ] Branches created from current HEAD

title: Multi-instance Claude Code support (swarm mode)
description:
## Overview

Git worktrees + beads coordination for parallel Claude Code instances.

## Key Concepts

- Each worker gets an isolated git worktree on a dedicated branch
- Beads prevents duplicate issue assignment across workers
- Clean merge workflow when all workers complete their tasks

## Architecture

```
.vamp-workers/
  worker-1/  (branch: swarm/worker-1)
  worker-2/  (branch: swarm/worker-2)
  worker-3/  (branch: swarm/worker-3)
  worker-4/  (branch: swarm/worker-4)
```

## Workflow

1. `vamp swarm` - creates worktrees, tmux window with N panes
2. Each pane runs Claude Code in isolated worktree
3. Workers claim issues via beads (no duplicates)
4. `vamp swarm --cleanup` - merge branches, remove worktrees

## Benefits

- Parallel development on independent issues
- No git conflicts during active work
- Beads coordination prevents duplicate effort
- Clean merge at the end
